Job Title: Senior Security Solutions Architect

Location: Portland, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Senior Security Solutions Architect (Portland,OR)
Since 1993, Right! Systems, Inc. has been providing exceptional solutions and uncommon expertise to help our customers achieve lasting benefits. As a multi-vendor systems integrator, we maintain high level certifications with key technology partners for one reason: our customers.
Right! Systems, Inc. (RSI) is seeking a talented individual for the role of Senior Security Solutions Archtict. This is a full-time position.
You will be working on a team of highly skilled technicians and engineers across a wide range of disciplines, representing solutions from Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Aruba, Okta, Microsoft and more. Your role is to ensure that industry best practices and methodologies are applied to the deployment, integration, and operational support of our customer environments. Candidates must live in the service area and be able to report to one of the four office locations. Occasional travel and weekend work will be required. This role reports the CTO.

Duties and Responsibilities
Build and maintain a deep technical understanding of network and security technologies, including firewalls, XDR, SDWAN, SEIM, SOAR, other security solutions to present full solutions to customers and RSIWork with customers to design and scope new projectsDevelop bills of materials and solutions for customersConsult with customers on options and features required to meet business needsPresent solutions and scopes of work to customersDesign and planning on complex projects integrating multiple technologies across multiple disciplines as part of a team of engineersAttend or participate in various product training sessions and classes in order to broaden your skillset while maintaining RSI’s vendor relationshipsPartner with named OEMs by becoming the technical sponsor for RSI.Meet with customers to discuss and outline new technologies that improve and enhance their current environmentsWork with a cross section of the RSI team including sales, engineering and management to complete tasks as requiredPresent to AMs, management, other RSI personnel and customers on new technologiesAssist team on specific project consulting and/or escalated support as requiredWork with Engineering manager to provide input for training requirements for Security team in line with business objectives and OEM requirementsCollaborate cross teams to develop processes to drive security recurring revenue streamsProvide leadership and guidance for programs and OEM integrations as it relates to Security vendors. Work with Engineering Manager to integrate requirements into training plansMeet with customers, OEMs and RSI team members onsite and remotely as required to perform job duties effectivelyAttain and retain certifications as requiredOther duties as assigned
Requirements
5+ years of equivalent network technology experienceCisco CCNP Security or CCIE Security, Palo Alto Networks PCNSE, or demonstrable experience level requiredHands on experience deploying and designing complex network security solutionsHands on experience with PAN firewalls requiredUnderstanding of security framworks and compliance requirements for regulated industries requiredHands on experience with Cisco Firepower firwalls preferredPalo Alto Networks PCNSE highly preferredHands on experience with Palo Alto Networks Prisma, Panorama, and PAN SDWAN solutions preferredStrong design and troubleshooting skills for firewalls requiredHands on experience with Fortinet firewalls or Fortinet NSE certification preferredExperience with network segementaiton and datacenter security best practicesExperience with design and deployment of Cisco ISE or Aruba Clearpass highly preferredPervious experience as a consultant desiredDeep understaning and experience with advanced routing and switching protocolsStrong interpersonal, written and oral communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsHighly self-motivated, directed and organized with attention to detail and accuracyAbility to effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced scenarioStrong customer service orientationExperience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentProficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word)Experience in CRM databasesCandidate must have a valid Driver’s license

Compensation/Benefits
Annual Pay DOE
RSI offers competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package that includes group medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance/LTD, and PTO (Paid Time Off) for vacation, sick and personal leave needs.
Work with enterprise to mid-sized organizations and Fortune 1000 and Fortune 500 Companies, where you are considered a value-added resource to include training, certifications and career development opportunities.
Right! Systems provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, citizenship, status, national origin, ancestry, gender, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, age, religion, pregnancy or pregnancy-related conditions, physical or mental disability, marital status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
